discourse_list.title: [Informal Poll] Does MakerDAO want a mascot?

content.content: The idea of adopting a mascot was brought up yesterday on the G-n-R call and got some enthusiastic responses, so I wanted to bring it to the forum! Having a mascot does a few things for the community: It brings a stronger sense of comradery to us by increasing the team-aspect of the DAO. It brings even more prominence to the brand by having another image to remind people of MakerDAO. It brings cool new opportunities for swag, perhaps even a full mascot costume (idea?). It brings a host for animated video series, for Content Production CU. We had a few suggested mascots already from the chat on G-n-R #141, those are included in this poll. This is also open to more ideas; if we can gain something close to a consensus we can move forward with beginning some designs and bring those back for further voting.     Dragon - Guarding the Vat/Vaults Cat - Internet loves cats Dog - DAI Dog, in line with liquidations coding language Cartoon Burban - Strategic Happiness Core Unit Facilitator  A creature from the Comm-dev Portal (please note which one!) Something else - Leave your suggestion in the comments Nothing - We don’t need a mascot, Leave your reason in the comments     0 voters
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is asking for feedback on the idea of adopting a mascot for MakerDAO. The post includes a poll with several options for potential mascots and invites readers to suggest their own ideas. The post also explains the potential benefits of having a mascot, such as increasing the sense of community and brand recognition. Some readers have already expressed enthusiasm for the idea, but the author is seeking further input before moving forward with designs.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: But I mean what are some successful mascots for other DeFi protocols? I can’t think of too many. Ghost for AAVE, Llama for Curve, animation characters for YFI maybe. So not sure whether such effort is worth it.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None

content.content: I would say a Chinese dragon as DAI is Chinese.
A few more examples: ETHDenver’s PegaBuffiCorn MetaMask’s Fox Dogecoin’s Shiba Inu is probably the most prominent and successful example.

I like the idea, but who is going to use a financial product that has a mascot? I would also like to see us adopt a more professional, serious tone with the outside world so we can better interact with our peers in finance and governments. But that’s a totally different discussion and others may disagree.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I think having a mascot is an excellent idea and makes the products less intimidating and appear more user friendly. It also has the benefit of having the company stick in a person’s mind. Look no further than insurance companies to see how popular these mascots are, a few examples: Geico - Gecko and Caveman Progressive - Flo Liberty Mutual - LiMu the Emu and Doug Allstate - Mayhem Man I think its also a question of B2B vs B2C, with the dust parameter and gas prices where they are today, pursuing a B2C strategy is challenging for us but this will certainly change over time as L2s and scaling are implemented. We definitely want to be in the B2C space long term so I’m supportive of the mascot.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: PaperImperium:  I would also like to see us adopt a more professional, serious tone with the outside world    PS: just kidding  But I think we should also be able to have fun. This is crypto afterall.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: It’s not a bad idea to have a mascot but I’d say this isn’t really a priority either. How about we simply ask our followers on Twitter/Reddit to come up with one and we pick the most liked/upvoted entry? I also think it should be non-binding to prevent a Boaty McBoatface type result and I’d argue for a minimal or no monetary reward. It would be great way to engage the community and get some “marketing buzz” going. I am happy to make a post on the subreddit and link it to other places like r/ethfinance if this sounds good.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: PaperImperium:  I like the idea, but who is going to use a financial product that has a mascot?   I don’t see AAVE being misused by having a pet.  image1297×423 70.3 KB  I think I would expect a mascot to be chosen that goes along with what we present, Bitcoiner’s use the honey badger for how disruptive and bad boy in nature it is. From my point of view maybe and it is the dipper I would prefer the beaver to be used, we build bridges, work in community and channel the volatility of the market.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal

content.content: Saludiego_201:  I don’t see AAVE being misused by having a pet.   An excellent counterpoint
The “MakerDAO beaver” might be misinterpreted … not sure we want to go down that path.
Well, it was just my contribution, I’m sure there will be many better ones.
The connotations didn’t stop the Oregon State Beavers.
Very true…
We don’t need it. We are not mcdonalds. Also, obviously -  sandworm is The Maker. “The Dai must flow”.

I like the idea of something like the MetaMask fox, which is a brilliant piece of design/branding. Fun without being frivolous, with the choice of animal, faceted appearance and interactivity giving a sense of intelligence and responsiveness. But the fox is annoyingly taken. Squirrels are smart, agile, and have a proclivity for saving… Edit: This is also a great opportunity for a piece of marketing in the form of a community-sponsored competition to create the ideal mascot, paid for by the DAO. Pretty sure the awareness of a major prize would be well worth the awareness and buzz that would result.

content.content: We know Growth has a focus on Latam…why not use a cute furry creature from that part of the world as our mascot?

In Venezuela we call it “chiguire”, in Argentina they call it “Capibara”. But whatever it is, it is a love that animal, everyone loves it.  And everyone respects it Forget I said beavers, I’ll stick with “Chigüires”.  image696×364 113 KB

Maybe a Panda? p.s. nope, you don’t want a bear… ^^

content.content: Moving this discussion to a new poll including the ideas commented here     [Informal Poll] Following up: MakerDAO Mascot Governance       Following up on the fantastic response from the poll, here. This poll ran for a total of 10 days  The poll received 52 unique voters, with 63 total votes ending in:  Dragon - 48%  Dog - 19%  Nothing - 15%  Something else - 15%  Cat - 13%  Cartoon Burban - 9%  This is a follow-up informal poll that hopefully will lead to a consensus, which will be used to create a signal request that, in turn, will be used to formalize the potential mascot through Governance.  This poll will only allow one choice…
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
None of the topics listed match
